Posts.EditableText:
Hey guys, I feel silly for asking this, but how do I publish an unlisted web game for everyone? As I said, at the moment it's unlisted, but I'd like to get it listed.

Any help is appreciated.
Posts.HTML:
Hey guys, I feel silly for asking this, but how do I publish an unlisted web game for everyone? As I said, at the moment it's unlisted, but I'd like to get it listed.

Any help is appreciated.

Posts.EditableText:
Just wait...
Sounds silly, but it will be checked out, then it will be available for everyone...
But, if you want to rush it, post a link to your game here and then everyone that visits here will be able to try it out.
Posts.HTML:
Just wait...
Sounds silly, but it will be checked out, then it will be available for everyone...
But, if you want to rush it, post a link to your game here and then everyone that visits here will be able to try it out.

Posts.EditableText: Go to your 'My Games' page and select  'View/edit game listing' for your game. There you can press 'Edit this listing' and change the 'Who can access this game?' option to 'Everybody'
Posts.HTML: Go to your 'My Games' page and select 'View/edit game listing' for your game. There you can press 'Edit this listing' and change the 'Who can access this game?' option to 'Everybody'

Posts.EditableText:
You have to go to your game's web page and click the edit button. Then set it to be listed there.

Then you have to wait...

_ETA: Beaten to it my seconds..._


Hmmm, this should be the way to do it, but it isn't working. It's still unlisted. This seems to be a bug.
Posts.HTML:

Hmmm, this should be the way to do it, but it isn't working. It's still unlisted. This seems to be a bug.

Posts.EditableText:
A moderator has to test it out before it get's listed.

Sometimes there are hundreds of games published in one day, and it may take them a little time to get through 'the stack'.

---
DL makes a good point, too. You can post a link here, so everyone can play it until it's listed.

This is not quite the default process, but it's the way most people do it:
- make the game
- upload/submit it as 'unlisted'
- post a link here for people to test it out (there's ALWAYS something you didn't notice that someone will find)
- edit the listing, so that EVERYONE can access it
- wait a few hours/days until it gets tested and listed
    - if more than a few days pass, post about it here (like you just did)
Posts.HTML:

Sometimes there are hundreds of games published in one day, and it may take them a little time to get through 'the stack'.

DL makes a good point, too. You can post a link here, so everyone can play it until it's listed.

This is not quite the default process, but it's the way most people do it:

  • make the game
  • upload/submit it as 'unlisted'
  • post a link here for people to test it out (there's ALWAYS something you didn't notice that someone will find)
  • edit the listing, so that EVERYONE can access it
  • wait a few hours/days until it gets tested and listed
    • if more than a few days pass, post about it here (like you just did)

Posts.EditableText:
Pertex,

I'm on it!

---
Yep.

It appears that a moderator has to test and approve it first when you choose a category.

---

http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/i8xpc6jwue6xjtwq2tr03w/laser-sword-with-hints-example

I selected 'no' under: **Do you want to apply to put the game into a category?**

This previously unlisted game is now in the Sandpit. (It showed up immediately.)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30656341/29229260-f3836a32-7ea2-11e7-84b7-92107a76ac70.png)



---
http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/edx69umsmkgr2zplkj8fyw/phone-tag

I selected 'yes' to choose a category this time. (I chose Educational, just in case that comes into play.)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30656341/29229199-b12fc860-7ea2-11e7-8d7d-74b0b2c49e54.png)
